channel.title: Peace, love, creativity: Hope of mankind
channel.description:
This series presents lectures from the 1968 Cooper Union Forum. This forum's theme is Peace, Love, Creativity: The Hope of Mankind.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

image.title: Peace, love, creativity: Hope of mankind

item.title: Mythology of war and peace, part one
item.description: This program presents the first part of a lecture by Joseph Campbell, Sarah Lawrence College.
item.dc:creator: Cooper Union for the Advancement of Science and Art
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: The tragedy of modern Man, part one
item.description: This program presents the first part of a lecture by Lionel Abel, Professor of English, State University of New York at Buffalo.
item.dc:creator: Cooper Union for the Advancement of Science and Art
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: The tragedy of modern Man, part two
item.description: This program presents the second part of a lecture by Lionel Abel, Professor of English, State University of New York at Buffalo.
item.dc:creator: Cooper Union for the Advancement of Science and Art
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Intellectual love, part one
item.description: This program presents the first part of a lecture by Claude H. Miller, psychoanalyst.
item.dc:creator: Cooper Union for the Advancement of Science and Art
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Mythology of love, part two
item.description: This program features the second part of a lecture by Joseph Campbell, Sarah Lawrence College.
item.dc:creator: Cooper Union for the Advancement of Science and Art
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Economic implications of war and peace, part two
item.description: This program features the second part of a lecture by Merryle Stanley Rukeyser, commentator, author, columnist.
item.dc:creator: Cooper Union for the Advancement of Science and Art
item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: The nature of creativity, part two
item.description: This program presents the second part of a lecture by Alfred Jones, Co-Director, The Mental Health Center.

item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: The age of our discontent, part one
item.description: This program presents the first part of a lecture by Will Oursler, author, radio and television panelist.

item.dc:subject: World Politics

item.title: Love of humanity, part one
item.description: This program features the first part of lectures from Beatrice Fairchild, biophysicist, Columbia University; and Johnson E. Fairchild, geographer, social philosopher, Director of Adult Education, The Cooper Union.
item.dc:creator: Cooper Union for the Advancement of Science and Art
item.dc:subject: World Politics
